name: "Brian in Love" Trivia Game | 'Family Guy'- Season 2 | 10 Questions

questions.text: What show is on the TV in the beginning of the episode?
questions.explanation:
The Jetsons.

	In the show, George Jetson gets hurt on a high-speed dog-walking treadmill.  No one in the Griffin house actually watched the episode.

questions.text: Who was Chris talking to on the phone in the beginning of the episode?
questions.explanation:
His grandma.

	We are led to believe that Chris is talking to his girlfriend by the things he asks.  It's kind of disturbing to know he was talking to his Grandma the whole time.

questions.text: Who is blamed for urinating in the living room?
questions.explanation:
Stewie.

	The family begins wondering if Stewie is ready for potty training, and this is his way of telling them.  Brian is the actual person urinating.

questions.text: Who is revealed as the actual person who has been urinating?
questions.explanation:
Brian.

	Little is known about why Brian urinated in the living room until the family takes him to a psychiatrist.

questions.text: Brian's psychiatrist is named Doctor Camden.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Brian's psychiatrist is actually named Dr. Kaplan.  Dr. Kaplan is featured in a few episodes and he sorts out Brian's problems.

Seven.

	Brian explains that his urinary problems shouldn't be psychological because he leads a good lifestyle at seven years and he lives with a great family.

questions.text: What does Brian not do during his travels?
options: Run over a person in his truck
questions.explanation:
Visit Paris.

	Brian digs up a bone (and buries it), runs over Dean Koontz in his truck, and sky dives.  He doesn't go to Europe although he says he wants to during the episode.

questions.text: Who is revealed as the person Brian loves?
questions.explanation:
Lois.

	Since the cause for Brian's urinating is Lois, he must confront his problems.  He eventually does, and everything is straightened out.

questions.text: What is not an ingredient in Lois' "Noodle Caboodle"?
questions.explanation:
Salt.

	Lois uses Potato Chips for the crust of this dish.  Brian points out that Lois' culinary skills are only surpassed by her beauty.

Quagmire.

	Quagmire appears on the Channel Five News during Tricia Takanawa's report from a hotel room.  Mary Tyler Moore isn't a recurring character, and the other two never appeared.
